title: Footer
caption: Structure for contents in a content context..

body.raw:
The `<Footer>` is a content component, like the `<Header>` and `<Body>` and is used to help structure the contents of components.

It's used like the HTML `<footer>` tag.

The `<Footer>` typically contains information about the author of the section, copyright data or links to related documents.

For additional information please read the [MDN Documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/footer) or [HMTL Living Standard Doucmentation](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/sections.html#the-footer-element)

## Usage

### Import

To import the component you just have to use this code below.

```tsx
import { Footer } from '@marigold/components';
```

### Apperance

<AppearanceTable component={title} />

### Props

<PropsTable />

## Examples

### Simple Copyright Example

Simple `<Footer>` example with a copyright notice.

<ComponentDemo file="./copyright-footer.demo.tsx" />

### Footer with Links

The examples shows the `<Footer>` with a list of links inside.

<ComponentDemo file="./list-footer.demo.tsx" />
